title: Is bespoke, handcrafted cutlery the secret to 'mindful eating'?
text:
When mother instructed us to 'work from the outside in', she could not have predicted the gastronomic forces that would transform the tabletop from an intimidating array of fish knives, soup spoons and cake forks into the blank canvas it is today. Chefs from Copenhagen to Kyoto, having already rediscovered the allure of bespoke ceramics, are now looking to custom cutlery to bring something new to the table.

At Ernst in Berlin, Dylan Watson-Brawn recently commissioned a set of hand-cast silver spoons - slender of handle with a tear-shaped bowl - from designer Rainer Spehl in collaboration with jeweller Felicitas Seidler. Elsewhere, the 'spatulas' that Adam Reid serves with his signature Lancashire...
